question: Line demarcating the boundary between India and China is known as by which name?
explanation: The McMahon Line is the demarcation line between the Tibetan region of China and the North-east region of India. It was proposed by British colonial administrator Henry McMahon at the 1914 Shimla Convention signed between British and Tibetan representatives. It runs from the eastern border of Bhutan along the crest of the Himalayas until it reaches the great bend in the Brahmaputra River where that river emerges from its Tibetan course into the Assam Valley.
